title.narrative: The Gambia COVID-19 Preparedness and Response Project

Actual end date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

Total Disbursement in Second Quarter of 2020
Total Disbursement in Second Quarter of 2020
Total Disbursement in Second Quarter of 2020

title.narrative: Suspected cases of COVID-19 cases reported and investigated per approved protocol
Isolation and treatment centers with pandemic preparedness and response plans per Ministry of Health Guidelines
Health staff trained in infection prevention per MOH-approved protocols
Hospitals with personal protective equipment and infection control products and supplies, without stock-outs on the first day of each quarter
Diagnosed cases treated per approved protocol
Public Health Emergency Operation Center (PHEOC) activated and operationalized to support coordination and planning for COVID-19 or other future emergencies
Electronic Integrated Disease Surveillance Response (IDSR) using DHIS2 platform interfaced with laboratory management information system and animal health surveillance system established
Health centers reporting stock-out of tracer Infection prevention and control materials on the first day of each month
Points of Entries equipped and staff trained in SOPs (including for infection prevention and control, screening of passengers
Costed plan to collect, package and transport samples to the WHO recommended laboratories for COVID-19 and future emergencies developed and implemented

actual.value: Testing is currently being done at the National Public Health Laboratory so the plan is no longer necessary.

title.narrative: Rapid-response teams members trained and equipped to investigate cases and conduct contact tracing
Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) on sample collection, packaging, transportation and testing of samples

actual.value: SOPs on sample collection, packaging, transportation and testing are available and in place. All laboratory personnel involved inCOVID-19 response have been trained. This was done with the support of AFENET.

title.narrative: Table-top simulation exercises and findings documented to inform future preparedness and response activities

target.value: Report on table-top simulation exercises with recommendations or lessons learned

title.narrative: Health centers reporting stock-out of tracer Infection prevention and control materials on the first day of each month
Supervisory visits undertaken to nine Points of Entry
Treatment and isolation centres renovated and/or equipped
Border officers trained on COVID-19 prevention and control and contact tracing
Community-based nurses and PHO trained on COVID-19 prevention and control and contact tracing
Emergency Ambulance Services operational within one month of start of project
MoU signed with Republic of Senegal PHES

actual.value: No formal MoU signed but there is communication between the two countries

title.narrative: Non-incineration cluster treatment of healthcare waste from several health facilities established

actual.value: Healthcare waste treatment equipment procured and process ongoing for building the structure for the clinical waste treatment center

title.narrative: COVID-19 sensitization campaigns conducted in all regions
